headline.main: Alternate Sites Considered for Embattled Giant Telescope
headline.print_headline: Alternate Sites Considered for Embattled Giant Telescope

docs.snippet: A group building one of the world's largest telescopes wants to start construction no later than April 2018— even if that means it will have to build the telescope somewhere other than Hawaii....
docs.lead_paragraph: A group building one of the world's largest telescopes wants to start construction no later than April 2018— even if that means it will have to build the telescope somewhere other than Hawaii.

headline.main: Influential Texas Panel Recommends Halt to Use of Bite-Mark Evidence
headline.print_headline: Influential Texas Panel Recommends Halt to Use of Bite-Mark Evidence

docs.snippet: An influential Texas scientific panel recommended on Thursday that bite-mark analysis not be admissible as evidence in courts, a decision experts said could lead judicial systems in other states to exclude it too....
docs.lead_paragraph: An influential Texas scientific panel recommended on Thursday that bite-mark analysis not be admissible as evidence in courts, a decision experts said could lead judicial systems in other states to exclude it too.

headline.main: Teens Plead Not Guilty in Seattle Homeless Camp Shooting

docs.snippet: Teenage brothers charged in a drug-related shooting that left two people dead and three wounded at a Seattle homeless camp have pleaded not guilty to murder charges....
docs.lead_paragraph: Teenage brothers charged in a drug-related shooting that left two people dead and three wounded at a Seattle homeless camp have pleaded not guilty to murder charges.

docs.snippet: ALLENTUCK--Professor Jack, died on Friday, February 5th peacefully in his sleep. He was a nuclear physicist who did global nuclear power plant safety inspections the world over. He was a Professor of Electrical Engineering and received undergradua...
docs.lead_paragraph: ALLENTUCK--Professor Jack, died on Friday, February 5th peacefully in his sleep. He was a nuclear physicist who did global nuclear power plant safety inspections the world over. He was a Professor of Electrical Engineering and received undergraduate degrees from CCNY, and Post Graduate degrees from Columbia University, New York City, NY. He retired from Brookhaven Laboratories where he was employed for more than three decades. He is survived by his wife, Marcia Epstein Allentuck, a daughter Isa, several grandchildren, three nephews and numerous grand-nieces and nephews. He was interred at Mt. Lebanon Cemetery in Glendale, NY.

docs.snippet: DOYLE--Thomas L., Jr. M.D., KGCHS, KM, on February 10, 2016 of Forest Hills, NY. Dearest husband and best friend of Betty Ann (nee Mulvihill). Proud father of Thomas L. (Denise), Kathryn Chapar (George) and Christopher (Maureen-deceased). Loving P...
docs.lead_paragraph:
DOYLE--Thomas L., Jr. M.D.,

KGCHS, KM, on February 10, 2016 of Forest Hills, NY. Dearest husband and best friend of Betty Ann (nee Mulvihill). Proud father of Thomas L. (Denise), Kathryn Chapar (George) and Christopher (Maureen-deceased). Loving Poppi to Nicholas, Molly and Peter T. Chapar, Kristin and Kelly Doyle and William T., Megan, John and Grace Doyle. Dr. Doyle attended with highest honors Xavier High School, Fordham College and Cornell Medical School. He was the very best of men and he was loved so much. He will be missed. Visiting hours at Fox Funeral Home, Inc. 98-07 Ascan Ave., corner of Metropolitan Ave., Forest Hills, 2-5pm on Sunday and 2-5pm and 7-9pm on Monday. Funeral Mass at Our Lady Queen of Martyrs Church on Tuesday at 10:30am. Interment St. John Cemetery.

docs.snippet: DUKE--Robin, Hon. Appeal of Conscience Foundation mourns Ambassador Robin Chandler Duke, long-time trustee, who with her husband Ambassador Angier Biddle Duke, past Chairman of the Board, were committed to strengthening religious freedom, human ri...
docs.lead_paragraph:
DUKE--Robin, Hon.

Appeal of Conscience Foundation mourns Ambassador Robin Chandler Duke, long-time trustee, who with her husband Ambassador Angier Biddle Duke, past Chairman of the Board, were committed to strengthening religious freedom, human rights and tolerance. Our deepest sympathy to the entire family. Rabbi Arthur Schneier, President Archbishop K. Barsamian, Cardinal T. McCarrick, Vice Presidents

docs.snippet: WHITMAN--Edward I., 91 years young, died February 10, 2016. Loving husband, father to Howard and Richard, and daughters-in-law Joan and Hope and grandfather to Harrison, Ilana and Ashley, uncle and great- uncle. He was a force of nature and lived ...
docs.lead_paragraph: WHITMAN--Edward I., 91 years young, died February 10, 2016. Loving husband, father to Howard and Richard, and daughters-in-law Joan and Hope and grandfather to Harrison, Ilana and Ashley, uncle and great- uncle. He was a force of nature and lived by his own standards and rules, and was a loyal friend to many. Predeceased by his parents Philip and Julia Whitman and by the love of his life, Helen Whitman on January 15, 2016 after 69 years of marriage. Graveside services will take place on Sunday, February 14, 2016 at 12:30pm at Mt. Ararat Cemetery in Farmingdale, NY.

docs.snippet: BASSETT--Leslie. The American Academy of Arts and Letters notes with sorrow the death of our esteemed colleague, the Pulitzer Prize-winning composer Leslie Bassett, whose nobility of spirit is exemplified both in his music and his person....
docs.lead_paragraph:
BASSETT--Leslie.

The American Academy of Arts and Letters notes with sorrow the death of our esteemed colleague, the Pulitzer Prize-winning composer Leslie Bassett, whose nobility of spirit is exemplified both in his music and his person.
